description:
I ordered a small cheese and a cheesecake slice for delivery. Delivery was kinda late but it's okay I wasn't hangry.

Pretty gooood pizza, I like how thin the crust is and very tasty and stretchy mozzarella cheese, the sauce is nice too, I can taste the oregano. 

The cheesecake was whateva, nothing to talk about.
author: Shruti D.

description:
This review is based on the delivery order. $41 wasted...here is why!

Pizza was terrible. The meat and cheese fell off the dough. The dough was soggy. This have to be the worst pizza in my life.

The spaghetti with meat ball was edible except the meatballs were over cooked. It was tough, chewy!

The order didn't come with red pepper flake and parmesan cheese. It is a given for all pizza order.

Needless to say I was extremely disappointed and will never order from them again.
author: anita s.

description:
HI  I ordered a pizza at 6:20 p.m. and it is u:24 p.m. and it has not arrived.  Well over your 45 min. delivery window.  You are the only pizza delivery service we use.  There 30 magnets in our drawer. Is there a point where long time customers get preferential treatment or should I find another pizza delivery service? 

I just got the pizza over an hour and 20 minutes late.  Nice!
author: scott m.

description: Good food.  Not much room for dining in, but price is right and there are tables for those with nowhere else to go.
author: William C.

description:
Needed a Pizza for my bro celebrating his birfday.  He said "No cake please." Im always wary of Pizza because if you dont eat right out of the oven...it loses its luster.... So I checked within my radius...this one is in front of my church so I said "Why not?" And besides never had their pizza before so might as well try it out.

Ordered the House Combo and yes I added Pineapple just because....on a thin crust...and you know what? It did not disappoint.

Plus the guy who took my order over the phone was nice.

This maybe my goto Pizza place now.
author: Em B.

description: My favorite pizza place in town! Best pizza, pasta and subs!! Definitely my go to place for pizza with friends.
author: Clara L.

description: Paid $36 for a gross, large (but actually tiny), veggie pizza with very little cheese and old dry "fresh" tomatoes. This place used to be good, not sure what happened. Never again. The pickup did only 15 minutes, but I'm guessing that's where they went wrong. Spend a little more time and make it right!
author: Ramz A.

description:
Their website said it would take 45 mins for delivery - 1:16pm according to their confirmation e mail. It is now 2:00pm on a non-holiday Monday afternoon and still no pizza. The person who answered the phone at 1:30 said my pizza would be here in '10 - 15 mins' but obviously that was not true. No offer of a refund from them either.
I now have to make my sons something else to eat because they are starving at this point, and without a tracking feature on their deliveries, I can't take the chance of just waiting and hoping it shows up. Not impressed at all and won't be using them again. Far too many options in SF for me to put up with a 2hr wait for pizza!
author: Miss M.

description: Ordered pizza on yelp. Said it would be here in 45 min. Called an hour later. Hadn't even started making the pizza.
author: Kevin K.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza places in the Bay Area!! Their pizzas taste homemade. The spice sausage and honey is my fave cause I love sweet and savory. The mascarpone cheese they used was amazing! Friendly staff and excellent service :)
author: Alessandra L.

description: I go here when I want a basic pizza and that's what I get. Nothing fancy but sometimes it's just what you want.
author: erich i.

description: I'd recommend asking for the pizza to be well done if you're a fan of not having soggy pizza. Great quality and taste. I don't remember exactly what size we got, but a large was enough to feed two with leftovers for next day if you're into that sort of thing.
author: Taryn W.

description:
After having one too many drinks at happy hour last night (read: two cocktails), I was ready to call it a night...at 5:30 pm. You're probably laughing at me but once you get into your 30s, nothing sounds more alluring than plopping your hinny onto the couch after work and watching trashy reality tv. "Thigh brows on fleek", is the latest thing I learned. So it's cool to have bush sticking out of your panties from both sides?  

Anyhow, we were debating what to have for dinner. 

Me: "What do you want for dinner?"
Mr. NSS: "Something cheap."

Me: "I can cook but first I need to shop at the market."
Mr. NSS: "Uhh, shopping and cooking, buzzed/drunk? You'll max out my card and chop off your fingers in the process...what about In-N-Out?"

Me: "Umm, I guess--are you driving?"
Mr. NSS *looks outside the bar to see rain*

Both of us: "Pizza delivery!"

I hate doughy, thick crust pizzas so I came across Twin Peaks Pizza & Pasta on Yelp; they offer thin crust and corn meal crusts (+$1). You can order on their website (there's a $2 off $25 coupon code listed) or through GrubHub but neither offered the capability of ordering half & half specialty pizzas so I called in our order. The woman who took my order was very professional and surprisingly very friendly. I ordered an XL Pizza with Half Spicy Sausage & Honey (w/ mozzarella, mascarpone, parsley + red onion) and Half Twin Peaks (pepperoni, salami, sausage & mushrooms). An XL feeds 3-4 people but we always over order for leftovers. She said, the pizza would be delivered within an hour. It was delivered in 54 minutes. 

The pizza arrived lukewarm so the crust was a bit too chewy but it was better than eating a doughy crusted pizza from other neighboring pizza joints: http://bit.ly/1UXpBDo. My half was the Spicy Sausage & Honey which was a good balance of spicy, salty, and sweet but they were skimpy on the sausage. One of the slices had just one sausage which was a bummer. Mr. NSS' enjoyed his Twin Peaks half which had more robust toppings. 

Good pizza aside, my biggest issue was the price. I know everything in SF is getting ridonkulously expensive but I've never paid so much for pizza delivery in my life. Usually, when you do half and half orders, they charge you for the more expensive half. Per their website, an XL Spicy Sausage & Honey is $30.67 and an XL Twin Peaks is $33.66. I was charged $33.66 plus $3.89 for ordering the Spicy Sausage & Honey which is the cheaper half. With tax and tip, our total was $47.84...for pizza! 

Ahh the price you pay for being a lazy, drunk heffer.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I called in for a pick-up order on rainy Sunday afternoon while my girlfriends and I were watching the Patriots & Steelers game at The Bar on Dolores. We got a medium barbecue pizza special and I picked it up in 20 minutes. Even though they were conveniently located to The Bar and they were on time, I thought it was 1) kind of pricey ($26ish) for a 2) mediocre pizza. And- shockingly.... when I asked for paper plates (because obviously, shouldn't a pizza restaurant that has take out offer paper plates???), they didn't have any, so we had to eat off napkins at The Bar.

Meh- I would pass and probably just order for delivery on Yelp next time.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Called for delivery and was told it would take an hour (!!) for delivery - but it turned out to be over an hour later than that.  

Why so long? The delivery person did not know where Market Street was, where 16th Street was, or what 3rd floor meant.

Will never order from them again.
author: Jay D.

description: Last night I had a very good experience ordering a pizza from Twin Peaks Pizza. I ordered a Latin pizza that was very good and they talked to me 45 minutes. But within 30 minutes they were already at my door. great job
author: Marcos R.

description:
Pay attention to your total $, I think they run a scam. For a pickup order they charged me $5 more than they quoted when I came in to pickup, when I asked about the difference the guy at the counter said it was the couple sides of blue cheese that I ordered with my pizza (?) that added the couple dollars; well obviously I didn't order multiple blue cheese sides with my plain pizza, but even if I did, where were they when the rest of my order was pulled and prepared for me to leave. They just tried to add a couple dollars to my already overpriced total. I'll spare you the details on how they still ran my card for the wrong total (in their favor) even after I caught the mistakes....

It's a shame the pizza is so good here, bc the service is a sham.
author: Christian L.

description: Halloween was a crazy night. I went to twin peaks, it's was crazy, I ordered a house combo on a thin crust. Let me tell you the waiting was worth. Took like 25 min after I order but the pizza was incredibly. This was the first time I ordered here and I was not disappointed. The blondie on the cashier was so nice, and so happy and energetic. This pizzeria made my Halloween day, plus they had good candy in the front!! The food was great and the customer service even more. This pizzeria has won my heart over.
author: Jose D.

description: Excellent pizza! Was in town visiting and just happened upon this place. Friendly staff, short wait time and very tasty thin crust pizza. Looking forward to the next time I am in town.
author: Jenifer M.

description: Half my food did not arrive. The food that did was 45 mins late and cold. When I called and asked about my food I was met with hostility.
author: Patrick M.

description: Only order the pizza, and have them cook it for five minutes extra or you'll be sorely disappointed.
author: Sean S.

description: Ordered online. After promised time, called twice to verify "it's on the way". Finally, 50 minutes beyond the promised time, on the third call, they admitted the pizza wasn't actually made.
author: Chris T.

description: Def the best pizza and service around! Not just myself, but other people I know order and come from a far! Great pizza and nice staff!
author: Kevelyn R.

description:
I've ordered from them in the past and the pizza was pretty good.  Not any more!  What a disappointment.  It was very pricey ($48 for a pizza, small salad, one desert) and took over an hour and a half to arrive on a Wednesday night.  The salad was wet with lettuce that was soggy and limp, and very few mushrooms and olives.  The pizza was cold (obviously, after all that time...) and was not good at all.  A large pizza with about 10 slices of pepperoni and a handful of mushrooms.  What a ripoff.  The tiramisu was dry and stale.  God knows how long it had been sitting in that kitchen.

I usually don't complain but this time I did.  I called them about 10 o'clock.  The phone rang about 8 times before someone answered.  Before I could say anything, they just hung up.

Go elsewhere.  Anywhere else....
author: Larry B.

description:
Just picked up two slices of Pizza I orderded over the phone.An ice cold Pepperoni
and a burnt Margheritta with sheriveled Basil.
He told me it would take 12 minutes l was there in under 10. Box was sitting on 
the oven.
Looks like no more local Pizza for me.
author: John D.

description:
Good moms and pops pizza parlor! The pizza is pretty good and is sold by the slice or whole pies. They also have salads, pasta dishes, some sandwiches and appetizers. The shop itself has a few tables inside. Seems like there are a lot of regulars that walked in and out of Twin Peaks Pizza.  

The neighborhood is nice, there are a few other restaurants nearby and we had some pretty tasty slices or pizza here. I think Twin Peaks Pizza delivers also. The cashier behind the counter was pleasant. Pizza's also affordable. Beer and wine available. 

Too bad we ate dinner and watched the Giants lose to the Marlins....  :(
author: Ticha B.

description:
A fresh-out-of-the-oven huge slice of cheese pizza: $3
A bottle of Pacifico: $4
Not having to cook because your kitchen is stacked with moving boxes because you've just moved into the neighborhood: Priceless

Guess I've found my new go-to pizza spot.
author: Adena B.

description:
Their pizza is solid. It's not going to be on anyone's top 10 list, but a good option if you live in the Bernal Heights area and want something delivered quickly. 

I ordered a large "house combo" pizza (pepperoni, sausage, bell pepper, red onion, mushrooms) for about $33. It was decent enough to where I felt satisfied, but their pies are a bit pricey if you ask me. I'd definitely consider ordering from them again, although my search continues for my undisputed go-to pizza place that delivers in Bernal Heights.
author: Andrew E.

description:
A little pricey but food never disappoints 
Best value would be the subs
A must order is the jalapeno poppers
Update
Since new ownership the quality has gone down the toilet
author: John R.

description: The pizza is usually good here but the service is sloppy - like forgetting the provide ranch dressing with hot wings. It sucks to open your order and have an essential part missing. Might want to consider another place with better reviews.  Oh and the pizza was so cold I had I put it in the oven. Well at least it gave me some time to wait for the full delivery to arrive.
author: Christian D.

description:
If ever we don't have any food in the house, Twin Peaks is where it's at.

Se here's the thing: the physical store looks super divey.  I wouldn't have given this place a second glance if my husband hadn't ordered delivery once when I was out of town and sung it's praises.  I'm just kind of snobby I guess!  Point is, looks are deceiving, don't judge a book by its cover, etc.  The pizza is great and they have such interesting topping combinations.

Our favorite is the Noe Valley: it has cheddar cheese, red onion, bacon, linguica, and cilantro.  Sounds weird AF, right?  It is SO GOOD.  These toppings come together to make the best flavor profile.  I would prefer if they sliced the linguica a little bit thinner, but seriously this pizza is amazing.  We also (almost) always order jalapeno poppers too (why not, right?) and they are very tasty, but can be a little inconsistent.  Sometimes they're better than others, but always tasty.

We usually order online which is really convenient; they just changed their ordering platform which seemed to erase my account, so that was kind of a pain.  

Anyway, suspend your judgement of the crappy appearance of their store front, they are putting out quality pizzas at this place.  They have saved my bacon many a time with their delivery when I'm hungry and out of options in the fridge.
author: Rachel S.

description: Thank you Marcos for my delicious pizza (: I let a couple coworkers try the pizza as well and they really enjoyed it! I will definitely come back and get some more pizza.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: I ordered a pizza for a party this weekend and to say I was disappointed was an understatement. I ordered deep dish but after the pizza was delivered it was not deep dish. Apparently the "Chef" changed the order? The thin crust tasted like cardboard and there weren't many toppings on a "combination". There was little to no cheese. The garlic bread was chewy and not cold. For $50 I paid, I'm never ordering from here again.
author: David H.

description: I really don't know why I can't seem to find decent delivery to Bernal Heights, all I wanted was BBQ chicken pizza.  We almost ordered dominos (in fact, I tried but it was a 90 min delivery time) so I'm glad we decided to give Twin Peaks a try.  While a bit pricey, the portion for the medium 14" BBQ Chicken special was definitely more than enough for two people, probably perfect for 3 and the quality was great.  It came with sweet and tangy BBQ sauce, plenty of chicken, onions, and I loved the addition of tomatoes and basil.  It arrived pretty quickly and wasn't soggy.  I look forward to ordering from them again!
author: Chanel H.

description: I have to give this place a solid "meh". We ordered the vegetarian pizza with pepperoni and ate it only out of desperation. The middle of the pizza was soggy and floppy making it hard to eat, yet there wasn't enough sauce either.  The entire pizza was pretty bland tasting and not worth $40.
author: Jenna M.

description: We've ordered from here several times, typically through Yelp/Eat24. Tonight we ordered a pizza and a salad, that with delivery and tip and all was more than $50. It was supposed to take 45-60 mins. These stories are always really frustrating for the person they happen to but boring to read, so I'll keep it short: I waited more then two hours and I'm now I'm hangry and feeling mean. I contacted Yelp through their chat feature and got no reply, so then called the place directly and they said it was coming. It never showed up so I contact Yelp again who called the place and then told me the restaurant closed, but I should wait another 15 minutes to see if they show up, before agreeing to "cancel" my order for a refund. I didn't want to cancel my order any more than I wanted to sit around like a jerk for 2+ hours getting hangry, That's garbage of both these companies.
author: M B.

description:
..Stumbled upon this place while walking around the neighborhood of my friend's AirBnb and I gotta say I'm really jealous I don't have a Twin Peaks Pizza near me in LA.

I've never seen a pizza joint with such a creative and wide selection of signature topping configurations that are all available by the slice. On top of that, everything my party ordered had super fresh toppings and was cooked perfectly. 

Fifth star earned for very friendly and competent service. I'll be back if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Bob Q.

description:
Last week I ordered a gluten free pizza and I was impressed! Order arrived in 20 minutes (unheard of for SF food delivery), the price was affordable for a gluten free product (I am used to paying more), and it is the same delicious gluten free crust as Patxi's pizza (which is perfect since they have the worst delivery & customer service).

If you are gluten free but not celiac, this is where you should be ordering pizza delivery.
author: Shannon Z.

description: This place by far was in a worse place I ordered pizza from. A medium pizza cost $30 bucks to I didn't ask for thin crust pizza they gave me a thin crust watery soggy pizza it gave my cousin the runs worst place ever don't waste your time.
author: Ahmad O.

description: Always order delivery and it is always fast, fresh, and delicious. Our favorite pizza place that delivers.
author: Maggie D.

description: Recently headed back to this neighborhood pizzeria! Haven't been there in three years. Was stoked to see the place hasn't changed a bit! Same awesome pizza and aps! Try the spicy sausage pizza!
author: Ian N.

description:
The bf and I were craving pizza and Haystack was pretty packed. So, we came across this place while driving down Church. 

We ordered a small (6 slices) Piece of Heaven for pick-up. It is made with buttermilk ranch, lemon pepper chicken, zucchini, green onions, and heart of palm, which we substituted with pineapple and they were ok with it. 

We called it in and the lady said it would be ready in 15 minutes. Sure enough, I went inside to pay for it and it was ready to go. It cost about $23. The place is small inside, there's maybe only 2-3 tables. So, you're best bet is ordering for pick-up or delivery. 

Now on to the pizza...it was DELISH! We wanted thin crust and it was perfectly crisp. The buttermilk ranch went really well with the lemon pepper chicken. The pineapple added a sweet touch. I think it was a good call instead of having it with the heart of palm. But, anyway, the combo of everything tasted amazing!

We will definitely be ordering from them again!
author: Fallon P.

description: Got a slice for a little less than $5 with artichoke hearts and sausage. It was decent, but not amazing. It was nice to have a custom slice. The menu looks good.
author: Denise C.

description: The crust is thin and oddly flakey, not bad.  But overall, light on sauce and cheese was a little rubbery.
author: Josh K.

description: Love their pizza! Service is always great! Delivery is quick! Would definitely recommend!
author: Lorena A.

description: Disappointing.  We gave it a try over Haystack.  Had the combo.  One third of the pizza had no sauce or meat on it.  I don't mind paying the price but I do mind getting ripped off.  It looked nothing like the one on the website.
author: Ken B.

description:
Wasn't bad. Walked in noon time on a Saturday. Service was nice. Little pricey (beer (Corona) and a pizza slice (pepperoni) was almost $10.

A little greasy, but other than that - delicious.
author: Chris B.

description: Girls night out at Bingo hall adjacent to Twin Peaks Pizza order a slice to take home alone. Opened the box ..burner flat bread crust, extremely frugal with sauce and cheese mushrooms extremely tough very dry and tasteless. Put it in the freezer, took it back that following Friday after Bingo...cashier was too u understanding... she offered a combo slice... added a teaspoon of that chewing gum cheese.....took it home began to eat. And SHAZAMMM S LONG PIECE OF HAIR tucked away in the teaspoon of cheewyrubbery  cheese. I FEED IT TO THE GARBAGE DISPOSAL.
author: Danita D.

description: They spam everyone's doorsteps with their flyers, tacking them onto your door handles, banisters, etc. Don't come here.
author: Rich L.

description: This was my favorite spot to order pizza for delivery for many years. Something has changed in the last 2 months. The quality of the pizza has gone down. Twice now I've ordered pizza and it has been either under baked or baked too much, no care has been taken to how the toppings are done, and the pizzas were delivered cold. In addition, the delivery chap was clueless.
author: Cheryl L.

description:
This place has great garlic bread, decent pizza and wings, and is reasonably priced. Unfortunately their delivery people have been extremely rude and I don't think I will order from them again. 

Admittedly, my house is very hard to find. I literally live on a set of stairs, not an actual street, in the hills of Bernal. All delivery people have a hard time finding it. When I order online I give extremely specific directions, but I don't know how that gets passed from grub hub to the delivery driver if at all. 

Most drivers laugh and say "wow this place is hard to find".  Or at least they are not rude. The first time I ordered from Twin Peaks the guy ended up at the end of the block. It sounded like he had been driving around for a while. When he got to my door, he said *to my face* this wasn't worth it. This after signing heavily and repeatedly as I stayed on the phone with him giving him directions. 

I thought maybe that was a fluke so I ordered again tonight. This guy called and repeatedly kept talking over me, told me to "go stand on the balcony" (?? I don't have a balcony) and kept telling me "you have to help me" and then talking over me every time I spoke. He finally got close but we were not on the phone anymore. I could see his car but I guess he headed in the wrong direction, even though I told him he had to go UP the stairs (he went down). He called back and finally got to me. He shoved the food at me and said "I didn't sign up for this" and walked away. 

Thanks but no thanks Twin Peaks. I know my house is hard to find but you don't have to be a jerk about it.
author: Nichole B.

description: Ordered delivery from here while visiting from NY. Was very pleased with the pizza. We got a medium pie with extra cheese and I was surprised how much I loved it. Being from NY I consider myself somewhat of a pizza snob and I still very much enjoyed the pie we got. The crust was the perfect thickness and the sauce tasted great. The delivery guy was very nice and followed all of your delivery instructions perfectly. I would give it 5 stars but I am giving it 4 because as good as it was it is definitely overpriced. If they lowered their prices I could see myself ordering from them all the time I'd I lived here. Anyway if you do order - enjoy!
author: S H.

description: Wow ... this place has gone WAY down hill in quality.  This will be the last time we order this slop.  It came cod, flimsy, and tasted worse than the frozen pizza we had in the freezer.
author: Carl S.

description:
Didn't feel like cooking or eating out tonight. Looked thru my stash of 'delivery' menus and decided on Twin Peaks Pizza. My second time ordering with them.

Since I don't care for their pizza, I ordered a Spinich salad with bacon and their pasta dish of Half Ravioli and Half Spaghetti.  It was pretty darn good. Even had enough for leftovers tomorrow. 

The delivery was good, the usual 60 minutes.  Would order again!
author: Janet T.

description: Pizza slice fresh out oven, delish.... Brazilian can 'to be beat!!!! Yummy yummy.... Great on a Friday or Saturday night for a quick bite... Have a glass of the pinot.... Cool place in Noe Valley.....-:)))))
author: Lisa M.

description: I eat here quite often, usually getting the Combo, Pepperoni, or Hawaiian, with a ranch dip. The Combo is my favorite, which is very tasty, and goes extremely well with ranch. Atmosphere is welcoming and casual, and the service is great.
author: Eric C.

description:
Wow, what a terrible experience! I usually opt to leave no review instead of a bad one, but this place treated me pretty badly, and the food was bad too. Seems like they have some serious ongoing issues. 

If you don't have time to read this long thing, the summary is: the food took forever to get here, our order was wrong, they refused to fix it, they blamed it all on Grubhub, refused to apologize. The food was bad: wings were tasteless, lasagna was pretty gross. 

So we order, and an hour and a half later the food arrives. I figure, wow they must be having a busy night, but I'm glad the food is here. But then I open it and realize they forgot the mozzarella sticks and a few of the wings. I call the restaurant and not only do they not apologize, they blame it on Grubhub! They say that they ran out of mozzarella sticks, but can't update that on Grubhub and their wings order actually comes with 8, not 10 like it says on Grubhub. I ask why they didn't call me when they received the order and let me know what was up (which I would have understood) so I could change my order. They say that it's not their job and that Grubhub should have told me. At this point I was just pretty confused, because they were blaming things on Grubhub that Grubhub is just not in charge of. They got extremely defensive and kept having me talk to different people who work there. My friends were hungry so I asked if we could get some food, like maybe a cheese pizza, to replace the missing wings and mozzarella sticks. They say that they can give me a pizza, but it will take an hour (!), and that I have to pay more because the cost of the mozzarella sticks is not enough to cover the pizza. So at this point they are asking me to pay an extra 5 dollars... and wait an hour for food... after I already waited an hour and a half for the wrong order!!
At this point I told them, hey, I'll pay those 5 dollars, and I'll even walk to the restaurant to pick up this food because it seems like the delivery drivers are swamped tonight, but I'm going to leave a bad review. if you are willing to help me out even a little bit, by fast-tracking my order, or refunding my order, I won't leave a bad review. Is it worth it to you? And they said, well it's actually not our fault, it's Grubhub's, and we can't help you. So there you have it, here's the review I said I would give you!
author: Maya E.

description:
The pizza is awesome. The delivery service SUCKS. Anytime I order a pizza in advance online, there is some sort of mistake with the order and this time the manager on duty BLAMED me for it, like it's something I am doing wrong. She actually hung up on me. I spent $100 for a pizza party at my house and its cold. 

I won't be ordering there again.
author: Rachel S.

description: Great pizza worse delivery driver ever. One we paid for our pizza in advance, went to tip the the driver when he arrived, but the driver demanded that we pay again. We explained that we paid it already, showed him the recipe, but he still wanted us to pay again. After going back and fourth for 10 min. He said he'll call the shop and check. I guess they told him it was paid for so he left. No apologies offered, he just left. Oh and at one point I thought he was going to hit my buddy. I've never seen this before ever!!!
author: Lon B.

description:
I will never order from here again.

To start with the delivery person didn't know how to ring a door bell and left only to come back later after I called. Then he decided that it was ok to open the outside door and walk up the stairs onto the property. Next he tried to deliver it to my neighbors who have a different number than I do. The tiramasu was frozen and was crunchy when I took a bite of it. The pasta was dripping in oil and was overcooked and the poppers were covered in grease.
author: Dyami C.

description: The pizza might be delicious, too bad that I will never know how is it. I've ordered online, waited for two hours, and the order never arrived. They didn't try to call me, E-mail me, or reach out at any way. When I finally called them after patiently waiting for two hours, the restaurant just closed and no one answered to my call.
author: Tamas K.

description: I'm a traditionalist when it comes to pizza.  And Twin Peaks offers a great slice of pizza.  A solid sauce that's the right amount of sweetness and fresh cheese. Granted, the ambiance of the restaurant isn't great - so go for the za and accept the scene for what it is.  Or go the take out option.
author: Frank D.

description:
i have gone here at least 30 times for a slice over the years I have lived in this neighborhood, but TODAY WAS THE LAST TIME. It has gotten progressively worse, but I ordered a piece of pizza for $4.95 and gave $1.05 tip. they put a piece of overcooked pizza on my table ..THAT IS ALL, 
i do not mind eating a piece of pizza with my hands BUT HAVING TO ASK FOR A NAPKIN TWO TIMES? really, can you do a little better than that?
author: Eugenia P.

description:
I tried this place again - even tried DELIVERY again!

Pizza was damn good - I did the Latina, and it was perfectly spicy and the crust was AMAZING.  Not soggy in the least!

I take back my previous review.  It was clearly a one-off accidental issue.  I WILL order from here again!
author: Michael D.

description: Eh. Meh. Two stars for fast delivery. Zero stars for food quality.  I ordered jalapeño poppers and a cheese pizza.  The poppers arrived luke warm and without ranch. Instead they were served with marinara? Who eats jalapeño poppers with marinara?!? Pizza was hot but below average. The sauce has a weird sour flavor. It tastes like pizza that is being made by people with zero pizza experience.  I was optimistic. I'll stick to ordering from my usual spots....
author: Ashley A.

description: Ordered from here again. Their pizza was good but the sausage and honey pie was waaay too spicy. Maybe i'm just a wimp now, but I don't think it's worth ordering again - no subtlety to the flavors
author: Emma M.

description:
Of all the pizza places that deliver to glen park, this is the only one I have enjoyed, so I have had it delivered fairly frequently.

Pros: Good Crust - my number one pizza concern, good thin crust NYish pizza.  In terms of toppings - good selection.

Their pastas are large and generous, good meatballs.  I love their garlic bread.  You can order beer and wine and have it delivered. The service is prompt and polite.  You can order online via their website.

Also - if you order on their website instead of eat24, they don't charge $2.00 for delivery and they have coupons.

Cons: The $$$.  High for a pizza.  You want more than one topping pretty soon you are looking at a $30 pie, plus tax and tip.  I wouldn't call them stingy with toppings, but given the price, they are certainly far from generous. 

Slightly inconsistent.  Of the say, 20 times I have ordered from them, about 5 times weren't as good.  Their pasta sauces can get oily sometimes.  And the free "bread with butter" that comes with any pasta dish is lousy.

aside:

I wonder if ownership or chef has changed since the last 2 times in a row have been meh.  The Hawaiian pizza I ordered last time was heavy on the cheese and light on the ham and pineapple. 

But tonight kind of took the cake:  Someone manning the kitchen is seriously stoned right now.  I ordered a meatball sub, no onions and peppers, extra sauce.  It came with onions.  And 2 golfball size meatballs.  For a 10 inch sub.  Also, something was wrong with the bread, it was doughy and soaked through, like someone had undercooked it then put it in a sauna.  It was genuinely inedible - too bad because I have gotten it several times before and definitely enjoyed it.

Part of me wants to call and make a fuss, because I am a broke lady, and when I can order out it is kind of a big deal for me.  On the other hand, I don't want to be a dick.
author: M K.

description: They have upped their pizza game in the last year with some tasty/gourmet pizza styles! My favorite is the spicy sausage and honey. Service has been consistently upbeat and pleasant. Can't beat the location around the corner from me either for a quick bite.
author: Jen H.

description: Favorite pizza place in San Francisco. Great thin crust pizza with high quality ingredients. The restaurant is very small, but I think they mostly do delivery. Only negative was they don't have fountain soda.
author: David H.

description:
Large pizza with 3 toppings: sausage, mushrooms and onions.
$20.13 (had a coupon)
Delivery was right on time.
Thanks Twin Peaks Pizza for another great pie!
author: Thomas D.

description:
This place used to have good pizza. Until last week we ordered  a pizza for pick up. There was barely any toppings on the pizza and it was $18. Not worth it. 
Not getting pizza here again.
author: S B.

description: Pizza and breadsticks were great. Small dining room is perfect for grabbing a quick bite. They sell beer and wine, oh and did I mention they have a tv?! Delivery is available and I'm pretty sure I saw more than one delivery person! Great neighborhood pizzeria, we will be back soon!
author: Melissa R.

description: Just ordered delivery from this place. Was quoted 30-45 minutes and the delivery showed up over an hour later. Pizza was horrible, horrible crust, horrible ingredients, and the salad was wilted and looked old, with bad tomatoes and red onion peel inside! Way over priced for the horrible quality this place offers. Very disappointing for SF
author: Marwa A.

description: Got a slice of pepperoni for lunch in the middle of a noontime walk and ate it sitting on the steps of St. Paul's church across the street. The crust was quite good even though it was far too thick for my taste.  The cheese and tomato balance was fine with many pieces good tasting meat.  All the slice are reheated and the pizza maker followed through to make my piece really hot. It would be interesting to know if they could make a decent thin crust version if you order a whole pie.
author: Richard D.

description:
Absolutely love this pizza place...
Order: Spinach Salad with Bacon
and a Noe Valley Pizza. Amazing.
author: Danielle G.

description: While maybe not the best pizza in town thses guys serve up a solid no frills pizza. The service is great (I've never tried delivery) and the prices are pretty reasonable.
author: Mark C.

description: The Spaghetti and meatballs were good. If you're looking for pizza, think twice. The quality of the pizza is inconsistent. The second time we order pizza it was soggy, and undercooked - very disappointing!
author: Grae S.

description: Great pizza place! Family friendly, great service and the pizza is so good! Just the right topping to sauce ratio and the crust is delish.
author: meghan M.

description: Great spot to grab a pizza.  As you walk in the counter is straight ahead and they have a few tables for you to dine in.   The slices are very large and tasty.  I would stop in again.
author: Zach V.

description:
Decent food, but they don't honor their discounts for online orders. 

I paid for a medium 14" pizza with a $3 discount code, the receipt handed to me by the driver said $20.52, which is what I expected. However, the made charge to my card (on my monthly statement) was $24.62.

I suppose they added some other hidden charges as well. That's pretty bad.
author: Nathan E.

description: Solid place. No disappointments so far - very italian type thin pizzas so I'd give 5/5 if you like those as I do.
author: Sampsa J.

description:
Twin bill.

Loved the pizza on my first visit.

Loved the chicken sandwich on my second visit.

Almost big enough for two meals. Chicken is seasoned with oregano. Tomato sauce covers the bread. Small green salad on the side.

Not just another sandwich. A five star sandwich from a five star place.
author: Jason B.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood for 10 years, and tried this place 3 times. Did not like it the first 2 times.  They must have changed their staff, because I ordered a  pizza last week and it was great! I ordered an extra large for 4 people and we only had one slice left. Will definitely order again.
author: Cathy S.

description:
Wow, this place is so bad, if I could give zero stars I would.

I guess the trick is ordering online, cuz the woman who takes the phone orders was awful.

She screwed up our delivery order soo bad, it's a joke.  First, When I ordered the Caesar salad, she asked want type of dressing, lol.  Then when the food arrived, there was no salad.  Grrrr.  I also asked for the pizza well done.  It Wasn't noted on the ticket and the pizza looked barely even cooked.  

Stay far away from this place.  There's way too many better pizza places in this city.
author: jim j.

description: I've lived near this pizza place for 20 years before every trying it. About a year ago ordered a pizza to be delivered when was desperate for a quick dinner and had nothing in the house. Was I surprised! The crust was thin and crispy and it was delicious. Also was still HOT when it was delivered, which could be because I live close, but much appreciated. Usually get either a pepperoni or black olive and mushroom, or a half and half combo of both. I wish I had tried this place earlier! Not crazy about Patxi's and can't always get into Gina Lina or Delfina, but for a basic pizza at a good price, you can't beat Twin Peaks.
author: kim c.

description: Delicious pizza! The girls there are super friendly and service was great. We ordered a half-and-half pizza of Noe Valley and Sausage & Honey. I loved them both and the crust was awesome. The Noe Valley had bacon, cheddar, onion and cilantro (yum) with red sauce while the sausage and honey speaks for itself. They also have beer... What more could you ask for?
author: Joseph K.

description: It's reliable but not amazing. I go here because it's close to my house but I've always been satisfied. One time I ordered a small towards the end of the night (10 ish) and the cook already had a medium rolled out so he made me that size instead, but only charged for a small. It made my night :)
author: Lisa H.

description:
So this review is only for my one time experience with them on election night. We called to order a large pizza for delivery and they told us it would take 40 minutes. After 50 minutes with no one showing up at the door, I called to see what the status was. They said they were slammed because of election night and it would be another 10 minutes before it heads out for delivery. After another 20 minutes, I called again and they apologized and said it still wasn't out for delivery and it would take another 10 minutes. After 1.5+hrs, the pizza finally showed up and it was average at best. 

If they knew they were slammed, they should have been up front about it instead of over promising and under delivering. Don't call on Super Bowl Sunday unless you want your pizza on Monday!
author: Lawrence H.

description: 2.5 stars. Average pizza, but with above-average prices. Good for take-out when you are in the area and need something quick.
author: Janelle F.

description: You can order online and they deliver quite quickly. Lots of variety on the menu, you can't really be disappointed.
author: Hannah Y.

description: Their pizza is delicious they're delivery services however won't ring your doorbell so watch your phone.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Boo!
If you enjoy overpriced blandness please come here. 
Ordered a calzone, motz and ricotta with peperoni
completely flavorless
i also got a slice of choc cake (delivery)
and called back because that sad choc. mouse slice was 3.55
DISAPOINTMENT! the delivery guy came back for it
really though don't waste your money on either
this place was very disapointing
i'm usually a content yelper, promise. 
: )
author: Jill F.

description:
I'm very sorry to rank a neighborhood joint so low but my pizza was horrible 

Friends ordered a Meaty Thin Crust & I got a Cheesy Regular Crust 

We were originally quoted 45 min but the nice guy called us after 30 to tell us our order was ready....this was GREAT so we could walk over while it was nice & hot! 

Toppings were plentiful & friends said their pie was only okay.....mine.... 

I'll admit I'm a thick crust kind of girl & I knew this was not going to be a thick crust but crimmeny it was paper-thin & couldn't even stand up on its own.....floppy city 

The Pesto (which I ordered as a topping) was completely saturating the pie, as opposed to a topping where there's a dollop here & there. Same w/ the Ricotta Cheese 

Just oozing everywhere.....no "slice" in sight.  Literally had to spoon it off the plate b/c no way I was going to be holding that pizza 

Willing to give this spot another try & re-review but for now all I can say is I've definitely experienced better
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I have never been this violently ill from food poisoning....all night, all day, throwing up pizza. WTF? Sausage, corn, olives. 

Tainted meat? I have no idea.
author: H.S. G.

description: These slices are huge! We came here late on a Friday for dinner and ate-in. It's a small place but we ordered slices that were massive and delicious! The staff was also really friendly and it seemed like a place a lot of locals come just to hang out and grab a bite, real family feeling.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
No. I won't be ordering fom here again. I odered for the first time from Twin Peaks tonight, and what they brought me was a luke warm soggy crusted pie. Luke warm - ok, it's cold outside. But soggy crust? Not  the ,  too-much-oily-cheese-soggy, but it- got-wet-with-water-after-it -was-cooked, soggy. The way toast might be if someone spiit water on it. Really yuk.
I called to complain and the only response I got from the young person was sorry, I can't send you another pie because we are closed. Really?WTF? Thanks for trying, I guess.
No. Won't be going there again.
author: A. L.

description:
Over priced and just not up to snuff.

I found their pizza to be only so so... the crust was undercooked and soggy, the flavor was just ok... and expensive. 

I won't be ordering from here again.
author: James B.

description: This place is absolutely fantastic - highly recommend the Honey and Spicy Sausage pizza - it is absolutely a tribute to what a fine pizza should be.
author: Matthew K.

description: On line ordering is easy and delivery is pretty reliable.  The cornmeal crust is $1 more, but so worth it.  They have a tasty linguisa topping that we love. They deliver to Bernal.  The kids like it.  Sounds like 5 stars to me!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Definitely my new go-to pizza place. I cannot rave highly enough about the build-your-own salad, and I have never had a bad pie here. Never eaten in, but delivery has always been quick and courteous.

That said, I think it is a teeny bit overpriced, but hey, I manage to justify it several times a month anyway. I'd order twice as often if it were more affordable.

They have an admirable social media presence, and sometimes I find really killer deals on their Facebook page. They are very transparent, seem to respond to (the very few) complaints here on Yelp with dignity, clarity, and without defensiveness.

Overall, a local business I am more than glad to support.
author: Brooke B.

description:
Get the corn bread crust. You won't regret it! We're only missing one piece of the magnetic pizza pie on our fridge now... YUM.

I also apologize for the cruel comments I wrote in my last review. I was both angry and unjust.
author: Beth C.

description: Continue to love the online ordering.  Tried a "Latina" pizza tonight and my husband said it was the best pizza he's ever had, so I thought an update was in order! Timely delivery and everything as requested, pleasant person who delivered...and yummy!
author: Susan V.

description: Our pizza was delivered with the cheese and topping slid off to the side of the box and the bottom burned. When we called to complain, they offered us $5 off our next pizza. No, thanks. Won't be ordering from here again.
author: Leigh A.

description:
12/5/2014
I want to start by saying that if i could give them less stars i would. I heard this place was good so i ordered their pastas and they were literally the most disgusting things I had ever eaten in my life. Not only did it look, smell, and taste disgusting, but it also made me very sick. It is 2 days later and i still feel sick.  Something went wrong with my side of the order( that's my fault), so they said they had to remake the food and send it out again, and when it came it was hot but just awful. I don't know if they did it on purpose to spite me or their food is just always that bad, but i remember ordering from there a few months ago and it was not that bad. My stomach still feels like shit as I'm writing this review. Hope this place gets shut down quick.
author: Jeff W.

description:
I ate here last night using a yelp deal (thanks yelp!). I live like two blocks away and I finally got around to trying it out.

The employees are friendly, the restaurant itself is definitely busy when it comes to delivery so I decided to hang out (I was the only one on a friday night) but it's definitely worth it because the food is expedited since you'er hanging out there.

I would come here again. I had their Pesto Ravioli, and while not the most fancy, it was solid for a pasta dish.

Next time I'll try one of their signature pizzas since that's what they are known for
author: Eric A.

description: Yes, they have huge slices, but the pizza is a little greasy on the top and the cheese tastes cheap. The crust is pretty good but the sauce doesn't have a whole lot of flavor and in my opinion they don't add enough sauce. This is what happens when you live in SF too long - your expectations increase for food because so many places have fresh, local, organic options. On the plus side, they are open late and they deliver...and the folks that work there are pretty friendly.
author: Kel W.

description:
During the Lenten season back in college, Friday dinner was always a big deal because they usually served the most singular food known to man. So I thought outside the box.  I started ordering pizza on Fridays.  My toppings were mushroom, anchovies, and broccoli.  To me, this pizza was better than a margherita, and I love a margherita.

The pizza at Twin Peaks takes me back to my college days.  A thin crust, lots of salty anchovies, and thinly-slice broccoli with extra mozzarella and marinara. Oh, to be 18, Catholic, and in love with a pizza.  I guess two out of three ain't bad. :-)
author: Courtney S.

description:
I order from this place probably atleast once a week, and i am picky when it comes to pizza because i grew up on the east coast where "mom and pop" pizza shops are everywhere and you don't dare order from a chain.  granted their prices aren't exactly cheap but they have so many toppings to choose from and so many things other than pizza you are sure to find something for everyone here.  Their crust is the right thickness, and you can request thicker or thinner if that suites your preferences, and the fact you can order online, is AMAZING!  when will more take-out places catch on to how convenient it is to order via a website?  

The only complaint I have about this place is that they have magnets they give you with your pizza's and once you collect 10 you are supposed to get a free pizza.  Well I order from here weekly and it seems like about 1 out of every 3 pizzas I get they actually remember to put a magnet on the box....it would be cool if I didn't have to order 30 pizzas to get 10 magnets.  A promotional deal is a promotional deal and it's something that I feel should should be a priority to make sure every order receives a magnet, if you are going to offer a perk you should be consistent about it.  

Aside from my gripe about the magnets this place has pretty good food, and is worth checking out if you haven't eaten there...and if you have well, it's probably pretty obvious why you keep going back.
Also, try my favorite!! A cheese pizza with extra cheese and extra sauce!  it is DELICIOUS and for me a very nostalgic taste.  I also love the Brazilian salad minus the tomatoes with blue cheese dressing!
author: Morgan B.

description:
I opened a little shop near Twin Peaks pizza about two years ago.  Initially, I stopped in here and there to grab a slice while we built out our store.  I didn't pay much attention to what I was eating in those instances as we were pressed for time.  I simply shoveled the food into my body.

After being open for a few months, and finding half an hour in the middle of my day to relax and eat at the pace of a normal human, I noticed that the pizza from Twin Peaks was really, very good.  The crust, sauce, cheese, toppings - they were all perfect.  I began to visit more often.

During one of my visits, while standing at the counter waiting to sign my credit card receipt, I noticed the cook peeling tomatoes and stewing them.  I asked Bruno if what I was seeing was the norm, if they were indeed making their own sauce.  He confirmed that they make their sauce and dough from scratch, and that their cheese is freshly grated.  Their veggies are never frozen, and their meats are from high-quality and reputable ranches.

It doesn't get better than that.  Typically,  I had to travel to a North Beach Italian restaurant to find pizza of this quality.  Or stand in line for 30 minutes at the other couple of notable pizza joints.  Not anymore.  Now I traverse a couple of blocks and grab a slice from my favorite local Pizza spot.
author: Don S.

description:
We have now ordered pizza for delivery from Twin Peaks Pizza over 50 times. Out of that many times it would be impossible for every single pizza and customer service experience to be perfect but I'm giving them a top score because 98% of our deliveries have been fabulous. 

You also get 20% off an order after 10 deliveries. It used to be 25% but I can forgive that with the current economy climate. Let that cook keep his job!

I should also mention that they were only late once BUT it was on a Friday eve after 9 pm. I think that's totally forgivable. 

Must try!
author: Juliann B.

description: Im a little sad because I've been a loyal customer for years. They used to be my hands-down go-to. But recently the prices have gone up and the serving sizes have gone down. Even the volume of each topping is noticeably smaller now. Their build-your-own salad is still a favorite, but its getting smaller too - I ordered greek peppers on it tonight and I got a grand total of 3 greek peppers. They also used to be amazing on social media and offer great deals for fans and followers. No more. Still an ok choice, a little overpriced for what you get, but decent in a land of mostly bad pizza joints.
author: Brooke B.

description:
1- Great Pizza - had the Latina Medium
2- Friendly call in and driver
3- Good price

Will order again!

P.S. Not sure where Twin Peaks name originated for outer Church..
author: B H.

description: Margherita Pizza, flavorless.......... could have been cooked a little longer, crust was not crispy..... :-(
author: Altaeb s.

description:
I am so embarrassed to admit that I've lived within 8 blocks of this place for, um, over 15 years and never tried them out. 

I walked past recently and noticed that the had redecorated at some point and looked pretty snazzy. Then a menu showed up at my door so I ordered.

So good! I'm a big fan of Escape for New York but I think these guys have way better tomato sauce. Very delicious and I'll be ordering again soon!
author: JP C.

description: I wish somebody would create a quality non gourmet pie in San Francisco.  After getting my home spammed by these guys forever I tried their pizza and was immensely disappointed on all levels (crust, sauce, toppings).  I strongly recommend ordering someplace else.  I'd rather eat Round Table than Twin Peaks.  To me, it was on par with Domino's.  FYI, if you ever get to Italy find a Neapolitan pizza maker and experience the greatest pizza you'll ever find.
author: Michael P.

description:
Visited this place on a hot summer SF day (surprisingly!) and soon as I entered I thought we were in a steam room. It was HOT in there!  We asked the owner if we could sit outside.  Normally they don't do outdoor seating, but the owner (really cool guy!!) brought a table and a couple chairs out and allowed us to do so.  That's customer service!!

Pizza was a lot better than I expected...with fresh ingredients and not greasy at all.

I suggest they have a better wine menu which was extremely limited and put some air conditioning in the restaurant.  Other than that, this was a great pizza joint!
author: Emmett B.

description: Over priced for what u get. A thin crusted pizza with not much flavor going on. I also ordered jalapeno poppers which were over priced and seemed like they got from a bag. Not order again
author: Elise H.

description:
The pizza here is excellent! 

I took some back to my office and it was gone in a minute! Everyone was talking about how great the pizza was!

They do free delivery or you can come in and eat while using thier WiFi. Decisions, decisions....
author: Alicia N.

description:
Simply put...not worth it...

High price, low quality.....
author: Blake J.

description:
Be careful, we were served rotten ... spoiled food !!

Ordered the meat lasagna and spaghetti with meat sauce.  The food came within 45 minutes, and the lasagna looked good ... cheese browned on top.  However, one bite and we threw-up.  It had a sour taste from when the tomato sauce went rancid.  Yuk!!

Probably the same sauce they use for pasta and pizza.  They clearly did not taste the lasagna before they served it.  We will never order from here again.
author: J B.

description:
I'll admit it - I'm kind of a pizza snob. My expectations were not very high on this neighborhood establishment but I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered a regular crust pepperoni and sausage pizza (my standby order). Both the sauce and crust were excellent. I find those are the two items that can make or break the pizza. The sausage was a little spicy too which made it even more yummy.

As for all the complaints on delivery, I picked my up there and it was hot and tasty. Maybe to get a better pizza - pick it up from them. No complaints here.
author: Derek B.

description: I ordered 2 slices of cheese pizza to go and it was good. The price was reasonable and the customer service was friendly. I will definitely come back.
author: Mohammad A.

description: I've been a loyal Twin Peaks customer for several years, ordering a pizza delivery from them about once a month.  Their pizzas always featured generous amounts of sauce and mozzarella, and usually arrived warm if not downright hot.  However, for at least the third delivery in a row now, the delivered X-Large pizza featured skimpy amounts of both sauce and cheese, at basically room temperature. They also failed to include one of their little yellow magnets (save 10 magnets for a $20 discount on a future order) with the latest delivery, but I won't be saving or using them anymore.  If anyone were to tell me that Twin Peaks is under new management / ownership, I wouldn't be at all surprised. What a shame - I considered Twin Peaks' the second best pizza in S.F. (after Tommaso's), but not any more.  If you like dry, room temperature pizza with little or no flavor, then Twin Peaks is the place for you!
author: Pizza X.

description:
5 STARS.

ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS.
I called in the order 'round 9:45 and the pizza arrived by 10:23.

What I ordered:
Medium Hawaiian Pizza
Mozzarella Sticks

Let me tell you somethin', it all arrived hot and fresh!
UNBELIEVABLE. This never happens.

The crispy yet deliciously soft crust and the HOT FRESH toppings!
They even let me add on bacon at no extra charge.
The mozzarella sticks were crispy on the outside and the cheese was STILL gooey upon arrival. Unheard of? I know.

Let's not forget to add in the part about how the guy on the other end of the phone was delightful. He was friendly, and willing to satisfy all of our customer needs. ex. not ringing the doorbell because I live with a family of four!

All in all 5 stars. Unbelievably happy!
AND IT CAME WITH A MAGNET STAPLED TO THE RECEIPT.
So cute. Love them.
Never ordering pizza from anywhere else.

Thank you, that is all. Over and out.
author: Jena R.

description: Ok, first I want to preface this review that our experience was on election night. I can understand that fact that there would be some delays, but we were told 40 mins. Instead the wait was over an hour and half and the pizza was way too salty. We called they offered an apology but no other concession for being so late. It will definitely be the last time I order from them.
author: Ernest L.

description: Owner was very friendly when we walked in, even though we only stopped in to have a few beers and watch an NCAA game.  (We had dinner reservations down the street).  They changed the channel on their TVs to accommodate our request.  I will definitely come back to try their pizza.  Noticed that the staff was great with other customers as well.
author: Alfred G.

description: We ordered a "Bianca" (white sauce, ham, sausage, onion, peppers) with a regular-thickness crust, which was $20 for a 12".  Delivery was about 30 min at 6:00pm on a Saturday, no problem there. The soggy center was either oversauced or underbaked, hard to tell. Toppings were ungenerous. There was a 2" long black hair under one of the slices. We cut the center out, moved the toppings to the edges, and microwaved it, at which point it was pretty good, a nice change from tomato sauce.
author: Steel T.

description: Reliable, friendly delivery. It's not the best pizza, it's pretty fast-foodish. But the folks are nice and they deliver super fast, like under half an hour. Great cheese, good sauce, just wish the dough and over were a bit better.
author: Nelson M.

description:
My short and sweet review:

I ordered (delivery) Hawaiian pizza (regular crust) and it was delicious. The crust was slightly crispy, the pizza was hot and the toppings were fresh. 

Also, they have a "buy 10, get one free" deal, so if you're going to be a long term customer, there's some incentive to stick with them. 

Biggest downside is the price, which came out to around $23 for a large pizza and small salad. 

THE SCOOP: Coming from Chicago, I consider myself a pizza afficionado, and Twin Peaks did not disappoint.
author: Tom A.

description: Almost a year later and I still favor this pizza for delivery. They are incredibly fast (we've gotten our orders all the way over at Monterey Blvd. sometimes in under 25 minutes! The pizza is always tasty with a nice and thin, crispy crust. They have "collect 10 magnets get a pizza free." We've only worked up to 6, tonight will be our 7th...I wonder if we will ever get to 10.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I WILL NEVER ORDER PIZZA FROM HERE AGAIN AND NEITHER SHOULD YOU!

Because I received a flyer on my doorknob, I thought I'd give this place a shot.  After all, how can you netflix without a medium pizza and hot wings? I used their nifty online ordering system and fired up the movie, waiting patiently for my dinner to arrive.

Nearly an hour later, I called and the girl who answered was pretty rude to me when I let her know that I'd ordered a pizza that never arrived. "So?" she asked.  She finally checked on my order and realized it "hadn't printed out" so she confirmed my order (bianca with no onions) and assured me that they would make it a "priority."

Fortunately, my movie was quite interesting and another hour later, I called again because no food had ever arrived! The same girl assured me that it was "about to leave" and offered me a free soda.  NO SODA! Just send me my dinner! 

The food did arrive approximately 30 minutes later and much to my dismay, the pizza had onions on it. Even without the onions, the pizza would not have been good.  There are so many other, BETTER places to get your pizza.

THIS PLACE IS AWFUL!!!!!
author: Marcus C.

description:
SUCKED SUCKED SUCKED!!!

I ordered a medium pizza and calamari.  On time?  YES and thats why they got 1 star.  The calamari is inedible.  I think they breaded rubber bands and cooked them...completely unchewable.

And then theres the pizza.  Its cold...and the crust is soggy.  Absolutely nothing special about it...I could have done better walking to safeway and buying a frozen pizza.

$32???  Are you freaking kidding me?  NEVER AGAIN!!!!!
author: Robbie M.

description: Good Za, hood price and cold beer. How do you beat that.
author: Jovan M.

description: Great pizza, service and people.  Pies are solid, customer service is on it-- nice, responsive.  People are nice.  Lots to love about Twin Peaks.  Manager Bruno is da man!
author: Henry F.

description:
Wow, delivery within  25 minutes is awesome! The pesto sauce was really good and not too salty like some places. The crust was thin and crispy which I like, and the pie itself was not bogged down with tons of cheese. There is practically nothing I hate more on my pizza that too much cheese. Mama can't take so much lactose, and unlike Dominos would have the world think, not everyone likes their food dripping with queso.

Work Twin Peaks Pizza, work it!
author: C P.

description:
Ah, back in the days where 2 slices of pizza perfection was considered a binge. Now it's more like 2 whole pizzas but that's what you get when you train your body to fit.

Twin Peaks use to satisfy every need. I no longer live in SF so I haven't been here for ages but memories hold dear in my heart - they take me back to the start. I give them 5 stars for this.

I see their menu has changed, things are jazzy now like the popular pizza beasts. Thy use to be small and straight forward. I'm sure they aren't as greasy anymore either, what a shame. They use to be greasier than Little Caesers...I'm talking soak and stain the box kind of greasy. You know, just how I like it - to be able to see a layer of overindulgement filth on my fingers - where you need extra napkins for a good ole' wipe job. Now atta' pizza!
author: Food A.

description: Just bad pizza. Soggy with the cheese falling off and overpriced. Never again.
author: Casey P.

description:
I ordered via grubhub, and got an ETA of 1 hour! The pizzia finally arrived after 1 hour and 20 minutes. No comment from the delivery dude. At least say you're sorry you're late, or that the traffic was crap, or something.

At $18 for the 'house' pizza that was 'meh' and arrived warm-ish, I'm shopping around for my next order...

And I should add, that some reviews say that they give out coupons that let you jump the queue and get your pizza made immediately... so lame, no wonder I got crap service.
author: Marc S.

description: Not the most amazing pizza ever, but definitely good stuff. Their service is phenomenal even after over a dozen deliveries. Their prices are great. Their calzones and pizzas are very good. All their ingredients are fresh and quality. Their pasta isn't great, but it's fair if you're craving it specifically.
author: Corry F.

description: Really excellent pizza (love the Mr. Eddie!) and super fast and friendly delivery.!!!!
author: Diana D.

description:
Love, Love, Love this place.  This is the only pizzeria my hubby and I can agree on.  My all time fave is the baked Lasagna Bianca,  noodles with ham, mushroom, spinach, ricotta cheese & cream sauce topped with mozzarella cheese need I say more?  

We've never eaten at the restaurant but have passed by.  Looks clean with a good size eating area.  Delivery is always fast & polite
author: Sally R.

description: Friendly staff. Poor guy on the phone was juggling a ton of calls at once. Ordered a vegetarian pizza with a side Caesar salad for delivery. The salad was huge and worth the $8. There were two slices of tomato floating among the lettuce, which seemed pointless. The pizza was good. Could have been a touch hotter. I loved the garlic on the pizza. I still get amazed how expensive stuff, like pizza, is in the city. I'll order it again, but I need tweak how I like my pizza from here. The online ordering is cool...but it doesn't really help when you want to just look at a menu. I kept having to restart the page just to read pizza toppings. Not everyone knows what's on a "Bernal Heights" pizza.
author: Jena D.

description: Wow I cannot believe how much this place has fallen off. They raised the price on the Bianca by $5 (now almost $24 for a MEDIUM?!? whats even worse is I didn't know about the price hike until it was delivered).  Also I asked the guy to make it well done but when I got it, it was a soggy, mushy, pizza mess. So disappointing.  I wont be ordering from twin peaks again.
author: Adri C.

description:
I love the pizza and have eaten it for 4 yrs now.  The quality is pretty much consistent!  Unfortunately their delivery service has caused us 2 hr waits several times in recent months.  That's a REALLY long time to wait when you're hungry for pizza!

We'll be trying other pizza shops in the area before ordering from here again.
author: Elaine G.

description: My girl and I gave this place a try once since we just moved to Noe Valley. I thought the pizza was pretty generic as the quality wasn't really there and the price was way too high for the product received. Unless I'm really, really craving pizza and no other places are open, I don't think I'll be coming back here.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Dope.  Ass. Delivery.
I get the lasagna with white sauce and ham when I'm feeling particularly decadent.  Everything is pretty great except for the roast chicken, which I've found to be dry.
Try the BBQ ribs if you're hardcore.
author: Kati K.

description:
2.5 stars (Spaghetti Review only)

Shhh, don't tell anyone but sometimes I like overcooked pasta with substandard sauce.  It reminds me of the spaghetti that my dad used to cook and I loved it as a kid!

Sure I can whip up some pasta with a homemade a sauce easily.  In fact, I love doing it.  Chop up some ripe tomatoes and add them to a pan of olive oil and garlic.  Add some salt and finish with some roughly chopped Italian parsley and freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.

However, when I feel the need for some comfort food, I call Twin Peaks.  Delivery is pretty quick and the pasta is consistently cooked 3 minutes too long...perfect.

My sister's husband is Italian and happens to be an incredible chef.  One night I told her what I was eating, a bit ashamed.  She jealously said, "That sounds delicious!  Sometimes I wish that I could eat like that".  haha...

Twin Peaks, your $7.80 spaghetti and marinara sauce are alright:)
author: michelle s.

description:
The following information can save your life:

The common tomato has an amazing heat capacity.  A few slices of tomato, properly placed, can protect nearby objects from blistering heat.  Recall capping oil well fires in Kuwait circa '91 - inside those silver suits?  Brave men covered in tomatoes.  Space shuttle tiles?  Tomato based ceramics.  I don't have a smoke detector in my apartment because I don't give a damn.  I have tomatoes in my bedside table.

Ignorance of this property of tomatoes with regards to a pizza can be disasterous.  A few slices of tomato can add significant cooking time to the pizza, resulting in a sad, undercooked crust.  Twin peaks, you have much to learn about the tomato.
author: Big Stu L.

description:
I think the pizza maker at Twin Peaks Pizza either takes a lot of pride in his creations, or else is obsessive-compulsive (but in a good way that I can truly appreciate).  I got a half chicken special (chicken, zucchini, and hearts of palm)/half ground beef and green onion pie, and when I opened up the box to check the order, I was blown away by how absolutely perfectly the toppings were arranged.  It looked like a pizza that had been produced for an advertising shot or something -- y'know, like how a big mac in the commercial is totally done up, but the one you actually get at the drive-thru is a sad, messy version of it.  I mean, this pizza had a very definite line across the middle of it, and NONE of the toppings from either half were intermingled.  I was so impressed that I took a picture, which I will post once I download it from the camera.  It was beautiful!

The pizza itself was decent.  Not the best I've ever had, but good enough that it earns Twin Peaks Pizza a slot in the delivery rotation.  The crust could've been a bit crispier, but that's nothing that a quick toast in the toaster oven can't fix, if I care enough to bother.  The chicken special is a surprisingly tasty combination, too.  

Another thing that especially pleases me is that all of the toppings cost the same amount.  No "this topping counts as three" anywhere to be seen.  And they have hearts of palm!  Yay Twin Peaks!
author: daphne w.

description: I love the pasta and the service here.  The food is good and they almost always deliver it quickly.  The best thing is that they have the best calzones I have ever had!
author: Bruce L.

description: Good pizza, big salads, fun desserts and honest dependable drivers. What more could you ask for? We love this place, order with confidence... they've always taken really good care of us, going on almost 10 years.
author: Arnaldo B.

description:
I do not give five stars to pizza places in San Francisco, and that's not cause I'm crazy about "real NY pizza".  I've never even been to New York.    It's just that I've never ever had such a hard time finding a decent slice in a city in all my life.  I think that SFers usually don't even know what pizza can taste like when done well.  Pauline's is what pizza should be, but jesus I spent over $100 last time I went there!  For pizza?!  Are you shitting me?  

That said, Twin Peaks makes a good pie.  Good crust, good sauce, good cheese, good price. It's the only place I'll even bother getting delivery from.
author: Napoleon R.

description:
I'm giving a low rating because their corn meal crust is not gluten free. In previous reviews people claimed that it was. 

For those of you with food allergies be careful before ordering.

Having said that if you don't have to deal with food allergies this pizza is tasty.
author: Megan G.

description: I've ordered the 'All the meat' and 'Noe' pizzas a few times and both are pretty good. Jalepeno poppers are usually great, chicken wings not so great. I prefer these guys over Paxtis, it's just better value and doesn't seem as ridiculously salty. Still feel I'm yet to find my go-to place for pizza though despite the accumulating Twin Peaks magnets on my fridge.
author: Alex B.

description: I usually dont really like thin crust at all. But the pizza there was REALLY good. the serivce was really good. I will definetly be back when I am in the neighborhood..
author: Latrice W.

description: This place is funny -- the service, decor, and menu variety is great.  I expected a crappy per-slice pizza place where you order what's on the counter.  I got a cute little pizza cafe with a totally customizable per-slice menu.  But -- the pizza isn't great!  Only decent.  Too much sauce, nothing special about the crust.  So, it gets three stars.
author: Bill H.

description: Been ordering delivery from Twin Peaks Pizza for years and they are always solid.  Good pizza, super reliable. Glad to have this place in the hood.
author: Molly T.

description:
Great quality toppings, a crust of better quality than most in SF (not saying much) AND you can order online - love that!

Pastas are bad for delivery, but where wouldn't they be?

Don't get pasta or salad, and garlic bread is so-so.
But again, awesome pizza & love the online ordering.
author: laura g.

description:
We order from here for three reasons:

1. First, and by far the most important, they deliver via online ordering.  That pretty much sold us.

2. They're nice.

3. Every 10th pizza is free.

The pizza itself?  Mediocre.  Not terrible, not a stand out.  It's just pizza.  But they've made it very easy to get that pizza from an idea in my head to my mouth.  So they win.
author: Brian D.

description:
We called twin peaks pizza and ordered a pizza, making sure to ask for it thin and crispy. 

I got another beer from the fridge, read a news article online and the doorbell rang. I thought...surely that is not the pizza already. It was. Thin, crispy and cheesy - just the way I like it.

While the pizza had all the neccessary components I like, there was something missing that made me go YUMMM. It was a bit bland? But a little garlic salt and parm cheese and I was satisfied.....(ate 1/2 the pizza kind of satisfied).
author: Megan M.

description: The owner runs this pizzeria with flair and friendliness. A framed City Proclamation of Bruno Matos Day (July 29) hangs next to the cash register. I need to branch out from my basic pepperoni, olive and mushroom with the red sauce and try out the pesto.
author: Derek S.

description: Had dinner here again, and realize now that I was overcharged a bit for the simple pizza Marguerita I ordered last time. Prices aren't that bad for very good quality pizza. This time, we also shared an excellent, generous mixed salad, at a very reasonable ($8) price, so I'm liking this place more. Again, the staff and service at this tiny place are awesome.
author: Lotion M.

description:
When moving here from Brooklyn I was terrified that I would never have a decent slice of pizza again.  While Twin Peaks is no Vinny's ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/vinnys-pizzeria-brooklyn) or Grimaldi's ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/grimaldis-brooklyn), they WILL deliver to my apartment. 

I lived in Brooklyn for 8 years and this makes me ferociously more qualified to rate pizza than you stinky California hippies so sit down, shut up and fuhgettahboutit. Got it, buddy?

Also notable:
*I've ordered from them almost a dozen times with no complaint AND also tried pies from several other promising menus in the neighborhood and due to my focused research and their great track record I refuse to order anywhere else. The bad reviews here seem to be fluke disasters occurring to one-time customers. 
*The internet ordering is totally convenient, especially if you want to pay by card.  They call you to confirm after you place the order.
*The biggest problem I have with them is that they are always out of Beck's Dark.  That being said, they deliver beer, which was amazing and novel for me being a relatively new transplant to SF.
author: Essron J.

description: My first order was tonight. Either I ordered the wrong pizza (Deep Forest) or it just wasn't that good. The service was great, delivery fast, but the quality of the ingredients,,,not so good, especially for the price- $24 (w tip) for a small.. :(  Wish I had just had a beer instead
author: Michele J.

description:
The Amazon Veggie pizza is really good.  I didn't want to slap anybody's mama, but I did sneak-eat the second slice the next day...when I saw a friend walking up the street to the house, I ate faster so he wouldn't know what a pig I was being.

He saw me anyway...and the excitement of the possibility of getting caught, avoiding getting caught, and then ultimately getting caught, made my heart race for a moment.

Thanks Twin Peaks Pizza
author: Nathan W.

description: This place has changed over the last year or so.  They have upgraded the interior and have a decent dine in business now.  They still serve pizza by the slice and it's made fresh.  $3.45 for a cheese slice.  it's thin enough to fold over with a nice crunchy crust and a fresh tangy sauce.  Maybe a little more sauce than I like but I'm getting picky...Friendly service.  Beer and wine.
author: Jeff J.

description:
Good pizza.  Really good crust, as previously stated, and not crazy dripping with grease.  The "specialty pizzas" with lots of toppings are probably not the best way to go -- I think this place does the basics best.  Nice little side salads for $2.50, as well, to help offset the pie.

We actually ate in, which I guess isn't something many people do, but it was cozy and the high school dude working behind the counter was nice and seemed to enjoy pretending to be a waiter for a bit.  He even brought the pie on one of those little silver pizza stands.  Fan-cy.

Good neighborhood joint.  We'll be back.
author: Megan D.

description: They make a good consistent pie, and deliver fast.  I like the website for ordering pizza, better than getting a busy person on the phone.  After you get 10 delivery magnets, you get a free pie.  The pizza isn't going to win any awards, but the convenience will.
author: bil t.

description:
i've had this pizza three times, three different ways - delivered, picked up, eaten in - and each time it was really good... very flavorful thin crust with just enough chew, well-balanced topping to sauce ratio, fresh ingredients, served hot, by nice folks.

i feel bad for the reviewers who seem to have gotten the crap end of a delivery deal. i too would be pissed if my pizza arrived deconstructed and cold. bummer. but what about the freak who gave one star because they discovered that Twin Peaks uses gluten in the pizza crust? uhm... hello! pizza dough is nothing if its not about the gluten dummy. 

i hate people. sigh.

anyhow, i've long accepted that im not gonna find a truly great bagel or pizza outside of the ny tri-state area so there's no sense in whining about it. im happy to have a tasty approximation and call it a day.

so far Twin Peaks pizza has proven totally respectable and deserves at least a first try.
author: Prattle P.

description:
We just ordered from there and the pizza was pretty good. Crust was nice and light, but rich. The dleivery was faster than the quoted 40 minutes and the service was polite.  but we ordered a large and we felt it was a little undersized. Also, our pie was a little dry, though, and it could  have used a little more sauce. 

All in all, a pretty good neighborhood pizza... Im just glad they deliver here.
author: Adam L.
