description: It's funny; this is my regular pizza place, and yet I only give it three stars.  I don't know what that says about me.  They make a good pizza - not great, but good.  Delivery is usually very prompt, and everything arrives nice and hot.  I haven't tried too many non-pizza dishes, but the tiramisu is all right and the cheesy garlic bread is nice if you're looking for cheese overload (as I sometimes am).
author: Michael I.

description: I love this place. They make great pizza, deliver it fast, and are super nice. Their pizza is great, delivered hot, and has some amazing crust. I wish I had more to say... they're just awesome. I've been going to this place for a good portion of my life, and they've only gotten better as time goes on.
author: Aaron A.

description: Awesome, great thin crust, nice menu of house pies. Fast delivery. We had the eggplant parmesean which was so tasty too!
author: Lester N.

description: Really great pizza, with enough variation in the menu to keep anybody interested. The price is comparable to most places, and some deals are clearly better. Love the food, the vibe, and the overall camaraderie at Twin Peaks!! Thanks guys for being one of the best in the business. Cheers!!
author: Will D.

description:
I typically order their pizza for delivery but tonight my wife and I decided to drop in and eat.  It's got a nice ambiance, great music and rather than choose the obvious choice, pizza, I chose a half chicken with salad.  Excellent sized bird, delicious and perfectly cooked.  The servers were nice and attentive and we ended the night with a slice of cheesecake.

We'll definitely stop in again.
author: Daniel P.

description: My daughter and her friend love Twin Peaks' broccoli pizza. Service is friendly, and they have good wine by the glass. A great Noe Valley resource!
author: Jeff T.

description:
Tasty pizza with decently thin crust (or thick crust if you choose that option).  

They do a great job with eggplant (no lumps of oily vegetable), spice things nicely, infuse garlic in nice edible  amounts, and generally provide a respectable answer to "What's for Dinner?"

Flawless, polite, reassuring online ordering and phone confirmation.  Precision drawing of "halves" so that the lovely eggplant doesn't contaminate the mammal-flesh  part of the pie.

Happy, efficient delivered food.
author: Galen W.

description:
Mediocre pizza with a bland crust and bland sauce and bland bland bland-o-rama.  Not greasy at all, though.

Very quick delivery.  

Food: 1.5 stars
Service: 5 stars  

Don't ask how that equals two stars... it just does.
author: Sleuthy W.

description:
It's tough to review pizza here in CA -- as much as I love the veg-friendly options and fresh toppings, the pizza just doesn't compare to the East Coast -- one of my few complaints about California in the 2+ years we've lived here.

That said, I had basically a neutral reaction to Twin Peaks Pizza. I love that it's close to our flat and offers several veg toppings and a vegan pizza. My small spinach and ricotta pie had nice fresh toppings, just not enough of them, and not quite enough sauce. 

I was glad the crust wasn't overly thick, greasy, and/or doughy like many of the pizzas here seem to be -- it had overall a nice chewy texture, wasn't too thin or thick -- but it could have been cooked a little longer. 

Basically, it was a decent enough pizza, and I think I would be more excited about this place if it were cheaper. I don't think it should cost $30 to pick up two small pizzas with three toppings total.
author: Karen W.

description:
Best delivery pizza you can get in Noe Valley/Glen Park.  Staff is friendly over the phone.  Treat yourself and try the desert pizza....mmmm, bananas and chocolate.

Pros: They do a mean sausage, mushroom, and olive pizza.  Oh and the above mentioned desert pizza rocks!

Cons:  Sometimes delivery is sloooow.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Yummy pizza but a lil' pricey.

They don't deliver to my neighborhood.

Collect their magnets, you'll get something free or discounted.

Last summer my wife heard the place was under new management and had good things to say after having a few slices at a kid's party. We went a few years without ordering from Twin Peaks.  I always felt their hearts weren't in making a truly good pizza.  Crust was always soggy and had the consistency of frozen pizza and they put too much cheese on.  I tried the plain cheese and sausage and mushrooms recently.  It's simply okay.  Less cheese but same boring crust.  Now I'm really worried that my wife is losing her NY edge after living here for 6 years.  I feel like I don't even know her anymore.
author: John C.

description: Ordered delivery from here a couple of times. Delivery time was pretty good, pizza was just average (especially for the price(.
author: Tom H.

description: Don't listen to the haters..this pizza is one of the best in the city.
author: Casey D.

description: Whenever I'm thinking about ordering pizza, I always think of Twin Peaks first.  Their pizza is consistently good, fresh and warm when it makes it to my place.  I also enjoy the wings.  Delivery is prompt and the drivers are friendly.
author: Tom D.

description:
Update: I gotta bump 'em up an extra star for following up to my 1st review. In all fairness I can't bump it up more until after I've ordered from them again. 
But I have to say I was really impressed with the fact that they contacted me and asked how they improve. They reponded again after I sent in my reply. Now that's customer service! I really thought they were going to curse me out after I sent in response.
author: Sheba B.

description:
Thanks to TPP I not only got my g/f off her wack Round Table addiction but found some pretty damn good thin crust as well. I'm a purist so I do not get toppings on my pizza: if the pie is good enough then it doesn't need a buncha distractions littering the surface.

No, it's not like the pizza parlor around the corner from your apartment in Park Slope, Astoria, or the Upper West Side. It's probably close enough so as not to matter, and the longer you live here the less you will miss the real deal.

Oh, and the calzones are not to be ignored: baked to near-perfection. I get the medium with ground beef and mushrooms, and it is so satisfying. Also reheats somewhat better than pizza does, which is odd since a calzone is basically a pizza turnover. But I digest...

Caesar salad on the side. Bonus points for putting so many croutons and so much grated cheese on the salad, and for adding tomatoes. 

AND you can order online. Much love for pizza and calzones via the interwebs.

Oh, delivery is fast and friendly so I always tip well.
author: ChickCaesar S.

description:
The roomie & I wanted pizza and decide to exapnd our horizons beyond the neighborhood joints.  After sifting through our take out menu drawer, we decided on TP P&P.  The prices seemed decent, they had a coupon and one particular pie caught our attention.

In the midst of our phone order, the clerk told us we couldn't use the coupon unless we spent over $30.  Now that clearly wasn't stated in the coupon or on the menu.  She claimed the old coupon had expired, but right there on our coupon it said "good anytime" with no expiration date.

We ordered anyway, but this put a bit of a damper on our excitement.

Cue to our doorbell, about 45 minutes later.  Money changed hands and we had dindin in our hot little hands.

As soon as we both smelled out pizza...well - our mood definitely improved.  We had ordered up a mostly meat pizza - sausage, pepperoni, linguica - and the scent was heavenly.

The pizza itself was interesting.  Very, very thin crust, which I wasn't quite sure about...until I took a bite.  Good stuff.  The sauce had a bit of zing, and the meat and dough were both cooked nicely.  And because the dough was so thin - I was able to stuff 6 slices down my gullet.

No joke.

So yeah - the coupon debacle aside, TP P&P turned out to be a nice little find.  It wasn't my favorite pizza in the city, but it was solidly good, delivery was on time, and we will likely make another order next time the pizza craving hits.
author: Christopher S.

description: I love the pizza here!  We used to order all the time when we lived down the street, but now we don't get it quite as often.  Our normal order is a cheese pizza with extra cheese and extra sauce.  You have to let it cool a little otherwise everything will fall off.  We recently ordered slices to go and you can order any kind of slice that you want and they make it for you right then.  It only takes about 5 minutes for the slice which isn't too bad when it's custom made.  There sauce is so tasty.  It has the perfect balance of sweetness and tomatoey tartness.  The sauce can really make or break a pizza and this one is pretty yummy.
author: Lindsey S.

description: I ordered from Twin Peaks for the first time tonight and they delivered.  Large pizza (16"), three toppings, using coupon mailed to me, $24 +tip.  The lady taking my order was competent and polite.  The delivery driver was the same.  They said 35 min. and were at my door in 25 min.  (This was on Saturday night, 9 pm, heart of the Mission.)  The pizza was very good.  The crust was thin and crispy and tasty.  Toppings: quite good Calamata olives plus good enough sausage and onions.  The sauce and cheese were fine.  Overall the pizza was very tasty and crisp, and it was delivered hot.    If I had to find a downside I'd say that for the money you can get a thicker, heavier slab of crust and mozzarella for the same price from other shops.  But this pizza was delicious and fun to eat and they delivered it just like I wanted.  I will order from them again.
author: Tom C.

description: This is the BEST thin crust pizza in the entire city. I don't care about your crappy local pizza place this is better. It took me for ever to find a good thin crust place and now I never order anything else( unless I need a deep dish but that's a whole other thing) I also love that after you collect ten magnets you get a free pizza. I can't say that I have ever tried the pasta but that's because the pizza is that good.
author: mark h.

description: Wandered by the other day, was greeted by an extremely friendly waitress, who made great recommendations, served it up by the slice, and was very attentive without being obtrusive.  Glad it's so close to my new place, as it's definitely decent pizza.
author: Adam T.

description: I know that it is Tuesday night, but I think we have found our new Friday night pizza joint.  Great pizza!  Had the regular crust and looking forward to trying out both the thin and thick crust next time around.  My daughter loved the raviolis, she inhaled them in about three seconds.
author: Jonathan S.

description: I once made the mistake of neglecting to order the thin crust here, and I will never do that again. Their regular crust is not up to par--the thin crust is much, much better. If you know pizza, you know that thin crust is really the only way to have pizza (unless you're going all the way to Chicago, that is), but just remember to request the thin crust specifically!
author: Jenn S.

description: I've generally been pleased with the pizza from Twin Peaks Pizza on Church Street.  The pizza is normally well prepared and the service is good.  Tonight, I was not impressed with the pizza I ordered.  The crust was completely burned and I was shocked that the restaurant even served it. The worst part was that I called in the order for pick up and didn't realize the pizza was so burned until I opened the box at home.  I ate a few bites and disliked it enough to call the restaurant.  Ultimately, the manager got on the phone and stated they took great pride in their pizza and agreed this was not acceptable.  I'm giving the restaurant three stars because they prepared an entirely new pizza and quickly delivered it to me. The second pizza was perfectly prepared.  I think when a restaurant tries to "make right" the mistake, that's worth a lot.  I will go back, but I will make certain I open the box before I take it home.
author: Ross C.

description: Decent pizza. We especially like the Deep Forest. On our first delivery order our pizza arrived cold and the cheese on half the pizza had slid off (when it was hot) and stuck to the box. On our next delivery the pizza arrived hot and intact. We like the online order option.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: Twin Peaks Pizza is one of my favorites in SF.  They use really fresh, generous portion for toppings and the crust is a perfect combination between crunchy and chewy!  The people that work here are awesome as well.  It is a good as a neighborhood pizza place can get...I highly recommend checking them out!
author: Jennifer W.

description: The first time I went there one of the guys gave me a free soda with my slice and that was really cool.  I like it better than Zante's.  The sauce is more on the sweet side versus Zante's. I'm still on the search for my all time favorite place in the Mission but I'll be going back to get a slice here and there.  Want to give it 3 and half stars maybe 4 but I need to go back again and have more pizza.
author: Sidney I.

description:
For me, writing a review is something that I always mean to do, but never really get around to doing it.  But yesterday's Bianca Pizza moved me to action.
I have ordered from Twin Peaks 20 times or so, and it is always excellent tasting, due to them using fresh ingredients.  The phone order takers are efficient, nice, and polite; and the pizza shows up hot and quick.
Now yesterday's Pizza... in the words of Ovo... WOW!

For the indoctrinated the Bianca Pizza is an interesting mix of Buttermilk Sauce, Ham, Sausage, Jalapeno & Onion.  The 'milk' of the Buttermilk counters the Jalapeno nicely, so the pizza is not spicy at all. 

So for you folks in the know, well done. For the newest among you, you should really give this pizza and the pizza place a try.

~Bill
author: William W.

description:
So I placed an order online and you can pay with plastic- Plus!
Then they called me back to confirm within 1 minute- PLus!
Pizza arrived HOT- PLUs!
It was Sofa-King Good.  Eat here!
author: David L.

description:
When you're in school forever, you do things you wouldn't normally do beyond the age of 16 FOREVER. Things like babysitting for an extra $50 on Friday nights while all of your friends who happily skipped away with their undergraduate degrees in hand are out partying. Such was the case for me and one of the only things that got me through was Twin Peaks Pizza. That's right: every Friday, for what seemed like an eternity but was in reality only a semester, I would babysit for a very nice family right around the corner from Twin Peaks Pizza. Because their child was indeed a BABY, I'd have hours on my hands to study, catch up on movies, and eat to my heart's delight. Back in those days, I didn't have to worry about getting fat, since I didn't really have time to go out anywhere where anyone cared about my weight and I spent so many sleepless nights writing, researching, and cramming that when I did finally eat, it made perfect sense to inhale a whole extra large, extra cheese and pepperoni and garlic pie from Twin Peaks Pizza. 

And oh, the calzones. Heaven! And oh the lasagna: Delicious! And oh, the meatball sandwiches: otherworldly. But my favorite remains the pepperoni and garlic calzone with extra marinara sauce for dipping. To. Die. For. And cheap, too. And fast. Now if only they delivered to my hood...
author: Autumn K.

description: We absolutely love this place. It's awesome pizza. Thin the way I like it. Our friends always rave when we order from here. We do delivery from here almost every Sunday night. Plus they have a great collect 10 magnets and get a free pizza!
author: Nancy G.

description: So disappointed my the pizza we got last Saturday.  It was a "cheap" pizza overloaded with sauce and cheese and totally turned me off the place.  We were able to eat it but will try some where else the next time we want pizza.
author: ORLA L.

description: Twin Peaks Pizza is the best delivery pizza place for Twin Peaks/Diamond Heights/Upper Market area by far. Actually I was really impressed with everything, the delivery time, the price, the crust. For sure will order again! Delivery guy was hot too.
author: Jack G.

description: Everything about this place is pretty cool, but does anyone else think it's fucked up that they know the door code to my building and I don't?  you don't think that's bad?  Try this one on for size:  Not only do they know my doorcode, but they won't tell me (the resident of said building) what it is!  They just lost a star for that shit.
author: Caleb D.

description: I love this place. My kids love it too. Very accommodating and they take direction well. Request well done, as with most pizza places to ensure proper pie integrity!
author: John E.

description: When we moved to our new hood, I was bummed because I could not longer walk to Giorgio's for pizza whenever I want it, but hey, I have found Twin Peaks--and they deliver. We ordered a simple half cheese and half peperoni pizza--thin crust--for delivery. I was told it would be 45 minutes to an hour, but in 30 minutes, my bell was a ringin'. The pizza was perfect--OK I only live 4 blocks away, so it was still yummy warm. We will venture into the restaurant here soon, but in the meantime--I have their take out menu. Damn good pizza.
author: Deborah S.

description: This is my local pizza delivery place, and it's great. I really like the specialty pizzas (particularly the chicken special) and I love that you can order online. And they always call right away to confirm your order. And the delivery guys are nice. Major plus.
author: Victoria A.

description: Pizza.  Bland but good.  Nothing special.  In other cities this place would get 2 or 2.5 stars but SF has very few pizza options.
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description:
Okay, here we go.  Worst.  Delivery.  Experience.  Ever.

I actually really like Twin Peaks Pizza.  So much so that I had accumulated 10 little magnets, the number you need to get a free pizza.  Yay!  It's, like, going to be a fun, free night!  Or:

I called them at 5:30.  At 7:00, I called them again.  They tell me the guy is on his way.  45 more minutes pass.  I call again.  Phone guy says driver guy tried to deliver, but I didn't answer.  Almost impossible, as my face was pressed to the window for the last hour waiting for dude, because I was so damn hungry.  Anyway, he asks me if I want them to bring it again.  Um, yes.  Yes I do.  I'm hungry.  At no point does the guy apologize, or offer to throw in a can of coke or anything.  Two hours plus, and counting.

It takes another hour for the guy to come.  It is officially three and one half hours from the time I originally placed my order.  Then instead of apologizing for the mix-up, or ANYTHING, delivery guy gives me enormous attitude, says my phone number is "bad" and none of it is his problem.

I'm sorry, but since when is a customer's satisfaction not the concern of an employee of a certain establishment?  Am I insane?  Dude proceeds to try to refuse my magnet-coupons and make me pay anyway.  I finally shove my precious magnets in his grubby, non-customer-caring-about paws and slam the gate.

Screw you, Twin Peaks.  Honestly, all it would have taken was one measly acknowledgment that you had messed up even a little.  Instead, you make me feel like I'm the idiot.  Which I am, for ever calling you.  Never again.
author: k s.

description: We order from them regularly for delivery.  There pizza is great, especially if you like thin crust.  They do a great job and are fast and efficient.  We have tried a bunch of places in Noe for possible delivery when we moved here 2 years ago.  Twin Peaks is the best hands down.
author: Rajeev R.

description:
I'm surprised to read the negative reviews here for Twin Peaks Pizza!  Its a great neighborhood pizza place and we have NEVER had a problem with the delivery or the quality of the pizza.  And we order a lot - we currently have about 9 magnets on our fridge and we've cashed in 10 magnets twice (you get a free pizza with 10 magnets, and you get a magnet with every order)!

It does seem that they have gotten new owners and revamped the place in the last couple of years, and personally I don't see anything but improvement!

It is super convenient to be able to order online.  Their salads are big and fresh, and the pizzas are delicious!  Our favorites are the Latina (lots of spicy sausage, jalapenos, and cilantro) and the hawaiian.  But the standbys like pepperoni are also delish.
author: Abby G.

description: Pretty good pizza, fast deliviery, very impressed that driver could find his way around Mt. Davidson, good deal with coupons, easy to order online. I agree that the crust was good and they followed my instructions not to overbake. So many places have pies with burnt cheese on top. WTF?
author: ALEXIS S.

description:
Twin Peaks fulfills all the necessities of your local pizza place.

 Recently they opened for breakfast serving the most delicious Brazilian pastries and fresh fruit smoothies! With my new health kick I would normally stay far away from a pizza place, but the salads here are huge and fresh and now my mornings are satisfied with their fresh fruit smoothies. 

Fairly Priced 
Friendly Service 
Quality food 
Great location (right of the J line)
author: Marissa B.

description: Great pizza.  I would give it 4.5 stars if Yelp would let me.  I haven't ordered Round Table since discovering this place.  Very yummy, quick service.  Get it well done w/pepperoni.  Mmmmm
author: DB C.

description: I really like the thin-crust and the fact that they have a vegan option-- it automatically comes sans cheese and with loads of delicious veggies.  It's very easy to order online and delivery has always been timely.  Plus, they give you those magnets to collect in order to earn free pizza.  Cute, and it gives me an excuse to order.  I'm a fan.
author: Christy T.

description: Pizza is just ok, but the calzones are AWESOME! And huge. Great veggie pizza & calzone combos too. Delivery is super-quick, as well. Always a huge bonus in my book.
author: Wendy G.

description: We just moved here from NYC where pizza is awesome. Didn't have high expectations for the pizza here. We were pleasantly surprised with our extremely tasty pizza. In fact, seconds after we finished the first one, we called to order a second.  Happy to have found a neighborhood pizza place.
author: Linda F.

description:
Wednesday night is pizza night. and with all the great pizza in the city, we're never at a loss for new places to try. I might be one of the only people in SF who doesn't immediately recycle the menus rubber banded to the front door of my apartment building. Twin Peaks left just such a menu.
I was very impressedwith their ingredients list- lots of meats, tons of veggies and a selection of cheeses and sauce options. most notable of these was hearts of palm, litterally one of my top 5 favorite food items and a rarity in salad bars as well as on menus- particularly of the pizza variety! 
jd picked two meats, pepperoni and salami, while I handled the veggies- hearts of palm and capers with some feta for good measure. we ordered the thin crust as well as took advantage of the awesome make your own salad option- all for about 33 bucks. 
we only waited about 40min for delivery and it smelled great! when we opened the box, though.... sadness. :(   there was only about the equivalent of 1 1/2 stalks of palm heart strewn about our quite large pizza. the capers were also so far and few between that there were whole slices of the pie which only had one or the other of my toppings on them.
while that really was a major dissapointment, on the bright side, it still tasted good. the sauce was yummy and the crust was perfect (I love crust). also, the salad was fresh and totally loaded... what a refreshing treat, cuz let's face it- delivery salad from a pizza place? that has waaay more potential of going the opposite direction of well! 
I think we will certainly patronize TPP again, but kindly ask for a more appropriate dusting of ingredients!
author: saraH c.

description: This is your standard pizza/pasta joint, and I love that about them.  They make a great pizza, and for those times when, if you're like me, you just want a nice spaghetti with marinara and a nice little side salad, this is the place to go. The employees are always nice, and they deliver, too!
author: Jenn K.

description: pretty good pizza, tasty ingredients, good delivery time. Crust was a little thick and chewy, but that's san francisco pizza for ya. Better than Cybelle's, at least the last few times I've eaten there, so I'll be ordering delivery from Twin Peaks from now on.
author: Jeremy H.

description: It is a sad state of affairs that I am giving Twin Peaks Pizza four stars.  However, after having an impossible time finding good pizza in this town, I realize that Twin Peaks is a four star delivery place for San Francisco.  But in writing this I'm starting to feel that, after three years in this city, I'm losing my grip on pizza reality.  Help!  Anyway, Twin Peaks has solidly good: crust, cheese and toppings.  Nothing to blow you away but good for a night with your lady-friend on the couch watching DVDs.  I'm partial to their pizza with fresh tomato and basil on top.  When I had the pizza delivered, they had an average delivery time AND the pizza was still hot, which is more than I can say for the rest of the places from which I've ordered.
author: LF P.

description: One of the better pizza places in SF, and one of the best to deliver.  We tried a few different pizzas, with the bbq chicken being the most adventurous.  It was really damn good.  The chicken wasn't dried out like a lot of other places and the fresh basil really made it.  I even had a few colleagues ask me where I got it.  I would order from them again, especially since you can do it online and they call back to confirm.  Can't get much easier than that.
author: Mrsdubyah W.

description: I had called this place at 10:55 figuring that they wouldn't deliver to us because it was too late. I really was waiting for that response but the guy who answered to phone decided to take our order. I told him he didn't have to if he didn't want to, I didn't mind and then I gave him a minute. He still wanted to deliver to me. I had just come home from a long day of work and then a bit of drinking with friends. Then I realize half an hour after he gave me a 35 minute wait that I didn't have enough cash and he didn't give me the total. I called back really scared because I though that I had just messed everything up but he was soooo nice and let me give him a credit card after I agreed to tip in cash. When it got here....the pizza was so yummy. It was worth it!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Their pizza is decent, and their delivery is fine.

But let me say this: DON'T go into the restaurant itself to dine in, unless you have plenty of time on your hands. We walked in, noted the almost-empty space, asked how long it would take for a slice, and were told 5 minutes. "Perfect!," we said, knowing I had to be downtown for a rehearsal and was planning to hop on the J after a quick bite. We paid at the counter and sat down with our beverages.

5 minutes go by, then 10...15...we ask if it'll be soon. "Yup!" 20...30... 45 minutes later we asked if we could have our slices to go. I wolfed mine in the car as my companion drove me to rehearsal. The staff apologized weakly but didn't seem concerned.

WTF? A slice of pizza should never take 45 minutes. The whole thing left a bad taste in my mouth, and it wasn't garlic.
author: kelly r.

description: Best pie in Noe Valley. One of the better ones in the city.
author: doug d.

description:
I think this place is great:
 
Online ordering? Check.
Timely delivery? Check.
Decent pizza? Check.
Menu with lots of variety? Check.
Fair pricing? Check.

They also deliver salads - eatable salads - not the for 'decoration' kind. Adding some 'greenery' to pizza night can only be a good thing!  Psychologically at least............

Highly recommended.
author: Maz C.

description:
My husband and I have sampled every pizza place in the vicinity and Twin Peaks is the best.  Their pizza is delish, their salads are good too, AND they are responsive to customer concerns about the environmental impact of take-out.

Check this out:  About a month ago I spoke to the owner about how I like ordering their salads (especially the Brazilian Salad with heart of palm - yum!), but that the fact that they use plastic "clam-shells" to package their salad to go gives me pause, being that the clam-shell is not recyclable in SF.  The owner told me he would purchase biodegradable salad containers . . . and in about 30 minutes I'll be picking up my first Twin Peaks eco salad!  I love how responsive he was to customer input.

If you live in Noe, this is the place for pie.
author: Karen S.

description:
Thanks Yelpers!!! Later in  the evening, work day and hungry, looked up what you all would recommend for a calzone and some pasta to be delivered. Twin Peaks pizza was great!!! Prompt delivery, great communication, friendly, great Calzone!!!! I would have given 4-1/2 stars but that wasn't an option, hazzle free and great!! The fettucine, well, a little bland, could have used some stand out flavor, a bit more garlic and cheese and less cream, but, hey, my food was fresh, tasty, delivered promptly with a friendly face. A great experience, I'd do it again.
Thanks!!!!
L
author: Lara B.

description: Live in the neighborhood and decided to give it a try for Sunday night delivery. Had a flier on the doorknob. A few bucks less expensive than the competition. But no bargain. We ordered a large pizza. It was scimpy on sauce, the cheese was minimal and the artichoke hearts had been pulled apart so that just a few single leaves were spead on the pie. All the ingredients including the pepperoni was applied stingily. The crust was not bad but very mediocre. We will stick with our usual Haystack, Nizario's, and Cybelle's in the future. There's a lot of good pizza in the neighborhood . Sadly, this establishment  just does not stack up.
author: Bob J.

description: i have been a relative fan of this stand-by pizza delivery option in my neighborhood, that is, until last night.  usually order a smaller pie, but this time we needed a large.  when it arrived 45 minutes later, it was so soggy i literally sopped the water up off it with two paper towels.  it was an embarassing excuse for a pizza. i immediately called TWP&P to alert them to the travesty.  in their defense, within 15 minutes, we had another replica sent over.  yes, once again, this one was soggy too.  i really don't think i can ever call them again after that experience.  should have had a digorno.
author: e w.

description: Easy online ordering and quick delivery.  The pizza is very good, the right amount of sauce and quality ingredients.  This is our go-to pizza spot in the neighborhood.
author: K V.

description: i have been getting addicted to their cornmeal crust pizza!!! YUMMM! they say it is gluten-free...it is gooooood! i get the corn meal crust with tomato, onion and garlic - just to put it out there!! and they deliver beer!
author: claudia o.

description: Twin Peaks is an easy-going, chill place. They serve a great pizza and they are always friendly. Its kinda tucked away on the end of church, but its definately a good find. They make pizza slices from scratch!!! You can get anything you want on a slice, and it only takes five minutes! Great place to go if you waiting for the J line. On a chilly day there's really nothing better than a piping hot slice with melted chesse and all your favorite toppings- the slices are HUGE too!
author: Sasha R.

description: love this place, great pizza, quick delivery.  the computer system is advanced, you can order online, they know what you like.  a little big brother as the other poster said but whatever - some of the best pizza around  (order thin crust)
author: Rob V.

description: You can stop fretting.  It does exist.  Tasty, East Coast-y pizza, as well-done as you like it, obtainable through cyberspace, and delivered promptly to your door .  Thank goodness.
author: Rachael S.

description: we ordered online, and wound up having to call them to confirm our order (they said they couldn't call an out of town number, but they had our email so they could of sent us a msg that way and i guess also they didn't have a cell...). anyhoo, they delivered relatively quickly, the pizza wasn't hot, but it was warmish. we had a 1/2 and 1/2 one side with pepperoni the other w/ chicken. the other toppings were fresh, the chicken, however, was not flavorful at all. basically the pizza tasted like domino's but with more toppings and a pizza hut crust. i wasn't won over, but my partner loved it.
author: Toisha T.

description: Though the place is small, the ambience is warm and inviting. The service was excellent and the pizza is WONDERFUL. The special "chicken delight" is awesome. I would go here again to eat there and to take home.
author: Steph W.

description:
good pizza, good service, fast.  exactly what i want.

no the pizza is not as good as the pizza on the east coast as mentioned.  i miss east coast pizza too, but.....i live on the west coast.
author: n. h.

description: I love this place! It's the closest thing we've found in all the neighborhoods we've lived in SF that compares to East Coast Pizza!  Plus the people that work there are great!
author: Stephanie M.

description: In most other cities, Twin Peaks would a perfect average three-star pizza joint - nothing too spectacular, just a solid neighborhood standby. But San Francisco is not a pizza town. Most of the pizza places here are over-priced, some are downright awful, and a few don't even deliver! Twin Peaks, with its tasty, reliable pies and prompt delivery, positively shines by comparison.
author: A R.

description: sadly, this is the only pizza place in my current 'hood. gone are the days of living around the corner from delfina pizzeria and walking distance to little star and arinell. i succumbed last night because we were too lazy to pick up take out from little star. we got the sausage, pepperoni, onion and green pepper thin crust, a small salad and the chicken wings. the pizza dough although decently thin and crispy was really bland--no flavor. the sauce uninspired. the toppings were generous and well proportioned. there's just no love in the pizza--NO LOVE. the chicken wings were a miss, too. they cook them in the pizza oven! they're not fried! they're not even oven-crisped (yes, this can be done, just bake them before saucing). i'm a wing lover, and the only way i could eat these wings was after my hubs shallow fried them in peanut oil in a cast iron skillet in our kitchen. that's pathetic when you have to finish cooking your own take-out. i haven't tasted their pastas, but i think i'll save my money for now. i can't imagine it's better than what i can put together with jarred sauce and FRESH pasta, organic veggies and meat that I can buy and cook myself. this is purely an emergency takeout place. lots of people in the 'hood like this place, but it's for the same reason we all eat at eric's chinese food--there's nowhere else to go!
author: E L.
